page.title: 02ECOLOGY
page.content: {Stoke Common},more properly called Stoke Common Poor's Fuel Allotment, is the only remaining{wet heathland}in this part of England. It covers about 200 acres and it has some Bridlepaths. After dry weather it is a pleasant wild area for walks but much of the time it is too wet. It has been designated as a{Site of {Special Scientific Interest}by the Nature Conservancy Council. It has over 300 species of plants including a type of orchid. Voluntary workers are now removing birch scrubland to retain this heathland.
